game_description: Red Matter is a story-driven VR puzzle adventure game set during a dystopian Sci-Fi Cold War. Take on the role of Agent Epsilon, an astronaut of the Atlantic Union dispatched to an abandoned Volgravian base on Rhea, one of Saturn‚Äôs moons. Your mission: to investigate a shady top secret research project. Solve puzzles in a beautiful, high-detail brutalist environment which only becomes more and more surreal as the story progresses. Use an array of hi-tech tools to decipher hidden messages and mechanisms and uncover ever deeper and darker secrets of the facility. But beware of what you may find... Once you discover the truth, will you be able to stomach it?
review_1: For graphics and atmosphere there's not much to beat this game on the Quest 2. I haven't felt this kind of immersion anywhere else. The puzzles are varying in difficulty, and can feel a bit mechanical, but some are really good. They feel integral to the story (although sometimes a bit "why would anyone do that?"), and can be solved by using logic and the game environment. If your don't like linear games, though, stay away. It's a straight railroad from start to finish. No jump scares, but some slightly creepy sequences. All in all probably the best game I've played on the Quest 2.
